poem:
### In the Shadow of Markets

In the hush of numbers, silence breaks—  
Borrowed breaths and whispered rates.  
The dragon stirs beneath cold tides,  
As gas forms shapes of ghostly white.  
A world unmeasured in coin is lost;  
Time marks a toll, unseen, and vast—  
Yet the earth turns, unmoved, unchanged.
